XmlServerInterface Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for XmlServerInterface:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A class used with xml serverlist

It is a XML interface for php files that manipulates server information.


Public Member Functions

 XmlServerInterface ()
 getAllServers ()

Member Function Documentation

XmlServerInterface::XmlServerInterface (  ) 

Creates a XmlServerInterface object

Define a XmlInterface for the ../servers.xml file.

XmlServerInterface::getAllServers (  ) 

Return an array of server xml nodes

Returns:
All Server XML nodes.

XmlServerInterface::getServerByName ( $  name  ) 

Get a server by its name

You can test the existance of this server with if ($server)

Parameters:
$name The value of the name tag
Returns:
The server xml node or NULL if the player does not exist.

XmlServerInterface::getServerName ( $  serverNode  ) 

Get the name of a server XML node

The good way to use this function is to get the server xml node first (by a call to getServerByName) and call this with the returned server.

Parameters:
$serverNode A server XML node.
Returns:
The server name or "" if the given server does not exist

XmlServerInterface::getServerIp ( $  serverNode  )

The good way to use this function is to get the server xml node first (by a call to getServerByName) and call this with the returned server.

Parameters:
$serverNode A server XML node.
Returns:
The server IP or "" if the given server does not exist

XmlServerInterface::addServer ( $  name,
$  ip,
$  port,
$  ftp,
$  desc,
$  technote,
$  maxclients,
$  time 
)

Add a new server

Parameters:
$name The Name of the server
$ip The IP address to contact this server
$port The UDP port
$ftp The FTP control channel port
$desc The description of the server
$technote The technical note
$maxclients The Maximum number of client accepted
$time The creation timestamp

Tells if the named server exist

Parameters:

Returns:
false or true
